meta.name: id
meta.title: Marshall Public Schools - Marshall Public Schools

div.p: Marshall Public Schools will be closed through the duration of the Public Health Emergency. Food Service will be provided to all children ages 1-18 (up to 21 if child is special needs) in the community. Please sign up to receive meals here. Please check out our Coronavirus Updates page for the latest information. https://www.marshallschools.org/coronavirus-updates.cfm

span.a: You are currently on this page - Home
Official Notices for Parents and Students

h4.strong: In the Marshall Public Schools, we offer a supportive,
flexible approach to providing an excellent education for each child.
We inspire everyone to achieve productive lives as citizens and lifelong learners.

em.span: We strive for excellence through continuous improvement. We treat each other with respect. We are one team: students, families, educators and employees. We approach our work with enthusiasm and a positive attitude. We hold high expectations for all. We cultivate innovation and creativity.

span.b: Marshall Summer School Registration Opens at 4:00 p.m. on Monday, March 30.
Register via your Parent Portal Account in Infinite Campus.

a.b: Check out our Summer School page for all necessary information!

p.span: Marshall Public Schools will be closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year. Remote learning will continue through the duration of the school year.
**Please share with any and all in the community. Breakfast & lunch is available to all children in our community regardless of whether or not they attend Marshall Public Schools.**

span.b: Marshall Public Schools will be providing FREE Grab & Go breakfast and lunch to all children ages 1 - 18 (through age 21 for those with special needs) via curbside service between 10:30 a.m. - 12:00 noon at the Elementary School and continuing through the term of school closure. This program is available to all children in the Marshall Community regardless if they attend Marshall Public Schools or not. There are no income requirements or restrictions. Please share with your friends and neighbors to encourage them to take advantage of the program.
Meal pick up will be at the Marshall Elementary School on Mondays and Thursdays. Meals will be distributed on the following schedule:
Monday pick-up/delivery includes Monday lunch, Tuesday & Wednesday breakfast and lunch, and Thursdays breakfast.
Thursday pick-up/delivery includes Thursday lunch, Friday breakfast & lunch, and Monday breakfast.

To assist in making sufficient quantities of meals and reduce waste, we are asking that meals be pre-ordered each week by Saturday at noon, for the following week. However, no child will be turned away. A new meal order form will be published and distributed weekly.

Students and/or families who cannot pick up meals themselves are encouraged to request assistance from a friend/neighbor or to request delivery. Students no longer need to be present to receive their meals. If you cannot make it to the Elementary School, delivery is available, just indicate that on your order form. The district is partnering with Go Riteway to deliver meals for those who are unable to make drive-thru grab & go arrangements.
Link to order your meals: http://bit.linfy/2Qm0Jwv

p.b: Visit https://www.marshallschools.org/elc/ to fill out an application.
If you have any questions feel free to contact the Marshall Early Learning Center at 608-655-1588

p.span: Exisiting families register here (who already have children enrolled at Marshall)
New families register here (please use a computer, most phones will error out)
More information on our 4K program can be found here.

div.h1: Open Enrollment Window is NOW OPEN!
div.p: Marshall is currently accepting applications for 4k-12th grade students who currently do not live in Marshall but wish to enroll here and those students who wish to enroll in JEDI, our virtual charter school.

Wisconsin's inter-district public school open enrollment program allows parents to apply for their children to attend school districts other than the one in which they reside. Parents must submit application forms to the non-resident district during the open enrollment period in February for the following school year.

span.strong: The Open Enrollment period for the 2020-2021 School Year is February 3- May 30, 2020 at 4:00 p.m..

div.p: To learn more about open enrollment click here.
If you need to open enroll outside of the regular enrollment period, click here to learn more. Please email completed applications to adriver@marshallschools.org

span.span: Thank you to everyone who voted on February 18. Our candidate pool has been narrowed down to 4; Staci Abrahamson,
Justin E. Rodriguez, Eli Bauer and Eric Armstrong. Learn more about our candidates below.
Polling places are open from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.. For more
information about the election or to register to vote go to
Candidate Questions from Candidate Forum (all 6 candidates)

font.span: Vote411 Voter information and questions Enter your address to pull up all relevant election info.

p.span: Check out our District Newsletter here!

span.strong: Wisconsin School Report Card Results Released

br.br: Marshall's 2018-19 results can be accessed below:

span.a: details on district and individual school results

p.span: Download the Infinite Campus App to have immediate access to the Student & Parent Portals!

p.b: This year, registration will consist of two steps. The first step is the Online Registration (OLR) and the second is in person at your child's respective school.

Please do not attempt to use a cellular/smartphone for the Online Registration process. Infinite Campus is designed for a web browser like those found on computers and tablets. In addtion to filling out the Online Registration, some if not all of the following forms will need to be completed. Please call the District Office 608-655-3466 or your Building Secretary for more information on the required forms.

All new to the district families will also need to complete the Enrollment Form, Medication form (if applicable), Immunization Form, Homeless Questionaire, transportation form (if need busing) and athletic forms (if playing sports). You will also need to submit proof of residency and birth date for your child(ren).

span.a: Enrollment Form- required for new students (English/Spanish)
Free and Reduced Price Meal Applications

td.p: During inclement weather, check the district website and social media communications, or tune into local Madison television and radio stations for the latest school closing information. The district's notification system will also alert families by email and phone. If there is a delayed start time, no morning Early Childhood or morning Pre-K classes will be held.

a.strong: Additional information regarding school closing decisions

div.p:
District Office
617 Madison Street
PO Box 76
Marshall, WI 53559
Phone: 608-655-3466
Fax: 608- 655-4481
